chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens
Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Lee Morarie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert Lee Morarie is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert Lee Morarie was found guilty of Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).
  • Robert Lee Morarie was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Apply bond on file and refund balance to payor.
DNA surcharge.

Defendant is eligible for Huber.
Defendant may serve in Balsam Lake with no additional costs to St. Croix County.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Evenson, ADA: Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY: Joel Kenneth Larimore  DF: Robert Lee Morarie appeared from jail. ADA Nieskes updates the court and makes recommendations. Atty. Larimore agrees.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Quash Warrant.

DE pleads G to Ct 1 and 5 in 15CF13. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 and 5 in 15CF13. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2, 3 and 4 in 15CF13. Sentencing arguments. DE is on a long term supervision in MN. DE makes statement. Crt orders:
Count 1
- 6 months St. Croix County Jail.
- DE eligible for huber
  credit for 33 days
- Costs 
Count 5
- 6 months St. Croix County Jail to run concurrent with count 1
- Costs
  credit for 33 days
DE to provide DNA sample and surcharges associated
DE able to serve in Balsam Lake. With no additional costs to St. Croix County. 
Bond is forfeited, return balance to payor.
to Transport. Signed by EJL on 4/27/2015. c: DA, cc: Rick. Fax: Sheriff and Jail. km
Extradite           EJL signed 4/22/15 - c: DA & SCSO. lw
